Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "the "linkassemblies" task failed for Android Xamarin Forms" (#1521) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @ExzaSolutions on December 27, 2017 8:25_

Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description

When the Xamarin Forms Project builds the Android build fails.
The android is set to build to Release,and the linking is set to Sdk Assemblies only.
When it is set to None it builds successfully,but the apk is far too big then.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Add Nuget Packages to Xamarin Forms Solution
2. Set Android Project To Release and linking to Sdk Assemblies only.
3. Build Solution

### Expected Behavior
Should build successfully

### Actual Behavior
Fails with "LinkAssemblies" task failed unexpectedly. System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set

### Basic Information
Microsoft Visual Studio Community 2017 
Version 15.5.2
VisualStudio.15.Release/15.5.2+27130.2010
Microsoft .NET Framework
Version 4.7.02556

Installed Version: Community

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Android] System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object. Object name: 'Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.Platform+DefaultRenderer'." (#1520) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @borbmizzet on March 27, 2018 22:38_

### Description
My app was crashing intermittently with a "System.ObjectDisposedException".  I have no idea what was causing it, but it seems to have something to do with an IsEnabled Property binding.  I was never able to trigger it while debugging, so all I have is the crash report from Visual Studio app center.  Sorry for the lack of information.
### Steps to Reproduce

Unknown 

### Expected Behavior
Not crashing
### Actual Behavior
Crashing
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
  - Android: 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 26.1.0.1
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms(.Pages) 2.5.0.280555, Acr.UserDialogs 7.0.1
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Note 5

### Screenshots

Android: 7.0
Android Build: NRD90M
Manufacturer: samsung
Model: SM-N920V
Start Date: 2018-03-26T19:05:24.761Z
Date: 2018-03-26T21:05:33.116Z

Xamarin Exception Stack:
System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object.
Object name: 'Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.Platform+DefaultRenderer'.

  at (wrapper delegate-invoke) <Module>.invoke_void_object_PropertyChangedEventArgs(object,System.ComponentModel.PropertyChangedEventArgs)
  at Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject.OnPropertyChanged (System.String propertyName) [0x00012] in <3754ae802c714b298131b9c985b370ad>:0
  at Xamarin.Forms.Element.OnPropertyChanged (System.String propertyName) [0x00000] in <3754ae802c714b298131b9c985b370ad>:0
  at Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject.SetValueActual (Xamarin.Forms.BindableProperty property, Xamarin.Forms.BindableObject+BindablePropertyContext context, System.Object value, System.Boolean currentlyApplying, Xamarin.Forms.Internals.SetValueFlags attributes, System.Boolean silent) [0x0010e] in <3754ae802c714b298131b9c985b370ad>:0

  at Xamarin.Forms.BindingExpression+BindingExpressionPart.<PropertyChanged>b__47_0 () [0x00000] in <3754ae802c714b298131b9c985b370ad>:0

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Android] System.ObjectDisposedException: Cannot access a disposed object. Object name: 'Xamarin.Forms.Platform.Android.Platform+DefaultRenderer'." (#1520) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
_From @borbmizzet on March 27, 2018 22:38_

### Description
My app was crashing intermittently with a "System.ObjectDisposedException".  I have no idea what was causing it, but it seems to have something to do with an IsEnabled Property binding.  I was never able to trigger it while debugging, so all I have is the crash report from Visual Studio app center.  Sorry for the lack of information.
### Steps to Reproduce

Unknown 

### Expected Behavior
Not crashing
### Actual Behavior
Crashing
### Basic Information

- Version with issue:
- Last known good version:
- IDE: Visual Studio 15.6.3
- Platform Target Frameworks: Android
  - Android: 8.1
- Android Support Library Version: 26.1.0.1
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms(.Pages) 2.5.0.280555, Acr.UserDialogs 7.0.1
- Affected Devices: Samsung Galaxy Note 5

### Screenshots

Android Build: NRD90M
Manufacturer: samsung
Model: SM-N920V
Start Date: 2018-03-26T19:05:24.761Z
Date: 2018-03-26T21:05:33.116Z

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "PushModalAsync on first run causes ObjectDisposedException for PlatformRenderer in iOS" (#2208) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I am developing an Android / iOS app that show's data from a client's CRM system. When attempting to show a notification in a popup modal, on iOS there is an ObjectDisposedException thrown. This only occurs when the app is first installed. If the app is being restarted, it does not occur. I have attempted to reproduce the issue in a vanilla project but have been unable to replicate the issue.

There is no issue in Android.

[Exception Output.txt](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/1858621/Exception.Output.txt)


### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a TabbedPage
2. On ContentPage as a tab, attempt to open another ContentPage as a Modal Popup.

### Expected Behavior
Show a ContentPage as a popup

### Actual Behavior
App crashes with an ObjectDisposedException

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 2.5.0.280555
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 v15.6.4
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - iOS:  11.2
  - Android: 8.1
- Affected Devices: iOS Devices

### Reproduction Link
Source can be provided privately

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Several Randomly Unhandled Exceptions!" (#2401) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Dear, I have been receiving several unhandled exceptions, unfortunately I not have the steps to reproduce the behavior, its happens randomly (some rarely):

**java.lang.StackOverflowError:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/b7a5823ba705cc84771501a45b6a6a3f. 

**java.lang.NullPointerException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/02aff3af2321271159607bd58292032a

**System.ArgumentOutOfRangeException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/870398dfc9455f6b2c7d71e11b8e9852

**java.lang.NullPointerException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/54dca62f1af6c105d1517fcbd76f68bd

**android.view.WindowManager$BadTokenException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/82cae6d2c04bfa34d02861dbb06fea6e
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/fe6822b6ce14d282e9adb561c61234e5

**java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/506729c4823f757f890e6fb40fc27a40

**java.lang.RuntimeException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/4c981d63159144999f47dc5aa11f9693

**android.support.v4.app.SuperNotCalledException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/44789f586d1f035f964cec07ac9eb5f1
**java.lang.IllegalArgumentException:**
https://gist.github.com/fernandovm/09060d6421989ef7d8d3eebb35810fd6


How I can deal with this? How I can help you to identify this problems?

### Basic Information

- Platform Target Frameworks: 
  - Android: 8.1 (Oreo) 
- Android Support Library Version: 26.1.0.1
- Nuget Packages: "Xamarin.Forms 2.5.0.280555"
- Affected Devices: Several, especially running android versions from 5.1 to bellow.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Entry with numeric/telephone keyboard changing app background color" (#2400) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened issue "ViewCell's with nested layout are not garbage collected causing huge memory leak" (#2399) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Opened issue "[iOS] Focus stops working for picker after it's already been focus then unfocused" (#2398) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues

### Description
Picker.Focus
Picker.Unfocus
Picker.Focus <- does not work

### Steps to Reproduce

Run control gallery test Issue2339 and just try to focus then unfocus then focus again

### Expected Behavior
Picker should keep being able to focus

### Actual Behavior
Picker stops being able to focus

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.0.0
- Last known good version: 2.5.1

### Implementation notes
The original purpose of the Control Gallery test was for windows but it seems from this PR
https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/pull/762
That that's ok

The Issue2339 should be updated to reflect that it only applies to iOS/Android and the behavior isn't consistent on UWP on purpose

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ListView with multiple columns" (#2397) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody: Current ListView implementation doesn't allow multiple columns, which can be very useful in ecommerce, gallery, and all kinds of other scenarios. Is there any plan to add support for that?

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Android Fragment Embedding Doesn't Work When You Rotate The Screen" (#2396) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

If you use a fragment created with `CreateFragment / CreateSupportFragment` - after you rotate the screen, all the content (view) of that fragment will be lost because the empty constructor is called by the Android framework.

### Steps to Reproduce

Checkout this commit https://github.com/cosminstirbu/Xamarin.Forms/commit/65fe6f2b0b38496a32320acdaab38092ff244511

1. Run Embedding.Droid
2. Rotate the screen - notice that everything works as expected
3. Tap on "SHOW EMBEDDED PAGE"
4. [Optionally] Set a breakpoint in EmbeddedSupportFragment parameterless constructor
5. Rotate the screen again and notice that the content is not displayed after the screen rotation

### Expected Behavior

The fragment should maintain it's state after re-creation

### Actual Behavior

The fragment doesn't have a view

### Screenshots

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

https://github.com/cosminstirbu/Xamarin.Forms/commit/65fe6f2b0b38496a32320acdaab38092ff244511

I think this is a major blocker in having Embedding feature being widely adopted in traditional Xamarin projects that use platform specific development.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Build fails for iOS/tvOS/watchOS Submission samples/templates project when profile and certificates are not set to "Automatic" in iOS project properties " (#3595) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create new iOS Single view app
2. Set configuration as Release and target as Device
3. Update build versions in info.plist also, set Bundle identifier as “ com.xamarin360.iTravel”
4. Update signing profiles to Distribution Peter Beaman and profile as “iTravel appstore”  in iOS project properties
5. Set app icons in Assest catalog  
6. Build the solution 
7. Right click on project and click on Archive on publishing 
8. After it succeeds, click on sign and distribute , click on App Store
9. Select proper provisioning profiles and create Archive 

### Expected Behaviour

Archive should be created successfully and .ipa should be uploaded successfully via App loaded 

### Actual Behaviour

 Getting build error : "
/Library/Frameworks/Mono.framework/External/xbuild/Xamarin/iOS/Xamarin.iOS.Common.targets(3,3): Error: No iOS signing identities match the specified provisioning profile 'iTravelAppStore'. (iOSSubmitAppSingle) " 


### Environment

https://gist.github.com/GLjackyvaswani/ee0b98d359ba37682120a5b4e5cbc092

## Regression : Yes , last know good build : Version: 11.8.0.20 (Visual Studio Enterprise)

## Screen-cast : https://www.screencast.com/t/TszYMbsCrNP5

## WorkAround : Go to iOS project properties and change provisioning profiles as Automatic and it should work now.

## We have tested this with D15-6 P6 build with XCODE 9.3 beta and there issue is not reproducible 

https://gist.github.com/GLjackyvaswani/400c9cdda81f930526e47d49ee4b528a  : D15-6 Preview 6 info
https://screencast.com/t/RP33IG5H7kH5  : Provisioning working as expected 


Test suite : https://xqa-testrail.eastus.cloudapp.azure.com/index.php?/plans/view/54354
[Archive.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/1757955/Archive.zip)
[iOSSubmitAppSingle.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/files/1757956/iOSSubmitAppSingle.zip)

Issue is reproducible for TvOS ODRS and watchkit submission sample too 

Link : https://github.com/olegoid/SubmissionSamples/tree/master/ODRsTVOS
https://github.com/olegoid/SubmissionSamples/tree/master/WatchOS

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Simulator bug After update visual Studio and iOS version" (#3664) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

 For selection display I use PresentViewController to show the drop down selection menu is open. 
 But After selection when presentViewController hide it display horizontal line in the screen.


### Expected Behavior
 This is original what i expected.

![simulator screen shot - iphone 8 - 2018-03-06 at 11 18 25](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16931935/37016383-e4990ee6-2131-11e8-8757-6d22172e39d5.png)

### When Selection is Open

![simulator screen shot - iphone 8 - 2018-03-06 at 11 18 31](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16931935/37016506-8e03c1ba-2132-11e8-9a2b-c95e02168018.png)


### Actual Behavior

![simulator screen shot - iphone 8 - 2018-03-06 at 11 18 37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16931935/37016406-04362f86-2132-11e8-9892-47f94b9bc8c4.png)

### Environment

```
Visual Studio Community 2017 for Mac
Version 7.4 (build 1033)

Xamarin.Mac
Version: 4.2.0.20 (Visual Studio Community)

Xamarin.iOS
Version: 11.8.0.20 (Visual Studio Community)
```

Any Help will be appreciated.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Debugger doesn't connect to keyboard extension on any device" (#3896) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
### Steps to Reproduce

1.  create a keyboard extension
2. add a breakpoint anywhere in the keyboard ext.
3. set the keyboard extension as the project to be run, build and start
4. you'll see the popup after the app is installed on the device to manually start the extension
5. go to keyboard settings on iOS settings app, add your keyboard ext. to the list of keyboards 

### Expected Behavior
Debugging should be possible, the IDE popup asking you to start the extension should disappear after doing so

### Actual Behavior
The VS IDE doesn't detect the keyboard extension start, debug breakpoints don't work at all on the device. After several attempts, the keyboard ext. doesn't even start anymore

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Bump mono to head of 2017-12." (#3854) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened pull request "Bump mono to head of 2017-12" (#3895) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Changes:

db625ea6 (Sebastien Pouliot, 18 seconds ago)
   Add new System.Memory facade (included in the bump) to the mobile profile

af8adace (Sebastien Pouliot, 2 hours ago)
   Bump mono to head of 2017-12

   Commit list for mono/mono:

   * mono/mono@b4e428d7c41 [sdks] Use wget in place of curl, it's installed by
   default on Linux (#8060)
   * mono/mono@1cb70ef771e [SDKS] fix Linux (and possibly other OSes) build
   for Android (#8045)
   * mono/mono@00f930c13d8 [SDKS] Fix Android SDK build on Linux (#8022)
   * mono/mono@911b32aef07 [runtime] Fix --disable-btls. (#8001)
   * mono/mono@82306753f93 [sdks] Fix MXE_PREFIX for XA (#8011)
   * mono/mono@edabe884172 [sdb] Add reference counting for single step
   requests, they can be accessed concurrently by the single step processing
   code and the event request clearing code. Fixes #7137. (#7973)
   * mono/mono@12304ec458c [2017-12] [Facades] Add System.Memory facade to
   mobile profiles (#7969)
   * mono/mono@9340ebefcd6 [2017-12] Disable building btls/ and support/ on
   the bcl build, they are not needed. (#7959)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump mono to head of 2017-12" (#3894) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Opened issue "Xamarin Forms crash in IOS project do not stop at exception line - do not display full exception trace" (#3893) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody: _From @olivier38070 on April 4, 2018 9:16_ ### Description When I debug an IOS project on a Xamarin Forms solution, when there is exception, the debugger do not stop at exception line the debugger do not display complete exception message exception message exist : I can copy the text on the popup and paste it in text editor. The option in Run, New Exception catch-point + Pause the program + When an exception is thrown are selected. ### Steps to Reproduce Create a Xamarin forms application in the xaml page, add a listview, with image and label. in code behind, load image with RSS feed images run the IOS project on ios device scroll the listview app will crash : see screen shot for code, please do not hesitate to check my github solution note : it is a work in progress, just for me to validate the stability of xamarin tools before working on it on production projects. https://github.com/ormaa/RSS-Reader_IOS-Android ### Expected Behavior The app should stop where the exception occurred the exception popup should display the message and stack trace ### Actual Behavior the app stop in main.cs the popup do not display any message, but a hort part of the message. no stack trace. ### Basic Information Version with issue: visual studio community 7.4.2 build 12 Last known good version: none MACOS High sierra 10.13.3 Xcode 9.3, swift 4.1 I obtain the same error when I run app on IOS simulator, or IOS device iphone 5S IOS 11.3 ### Screenshots ![screen shot 2018-04-04 at 11 01 35](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8026564/38298735-7bb40dbc-37f8-11e8-8126-e21bb8d2dc3c.png) _Copied from original issue: xamarin/Xamarin.Forms#2242_
